explanation:
The London Assembly is a government body that is part of the Greater London Authority. It is a 25-member elected body that scrutinizes the activities of the Mayor of London and has the power to review and amend budgets and strategies. It was established in 2000 and serves as a local government institution for London, with members elected using a proportional representation system. 

Key evidence:
- Described as "part of the Greater London Authority"
- Comprises 25 elected members
- Has powers to review mayoral budgets and strategies
- Operates various committees on topics like environment, housing, transport, and police oversight

[Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London_Assembly]

OPEC (Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries) is an intergovernmental organization of major oil-producing countries that coordinates and unifies the petroleum policies of its member states. It is a trade group focused on the global oil industry, representing key fossil fuel-producing nations like Saudi Arabia, Iran, Venezuela, and others. OPEC's primary purpose is to regulate oil production and pricing, making it fundamentally a fossil fuel trade organization that plays a critical role in the global oil market.
